content.raw:
I found a good reason to back up Steve's argument. For those interested, it's related to move constructors. If we eventually implement a move constructor, then it's easier and cleaner to transfer ownership using the overloaded `operator=` in `std::unique_ptr`. 

[Source 1](http://scrupulousabstractions.tumblr.com/post/37576903218/cpp11style-no-new-delete0

[Move constructor](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/move_constructor)

[Unique ptr owner transfer](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/memory/unique_ptr/operator%3D)

So, let's go with unique pointers, and disable warnings.
